title: Ribbon Control
body: Add an easy to use and customizable Ribbon control like the ones found in the Office Mobile apps, that scales on PCs to Phones. While we can implement it ourselves, it does require a lot of work, and putting it in a XAML control would make life so much easier.

comments.body: I think this should be like the ribbon in *Onenote for Windows 10*

I started developing a ribbon control, but it is in very early stage. And as Thomas says, its a lot of work. Especially when it is downsized an small screen devices, how should the items be dislayed in a manner, that you can still use the control on e. g. Phone devices with touch. Costed me already serveral nights to think about. My idea was to create a own button like control, that can be collapsed to something like a flyout and displays a icon on the left and label of the button on the right, just like the office mobile apps does

Classic line of business apps often have a navigation with a main menu and a toolbar or a ribbon control.
I suggest that you put a toolbar or a ribbon into the platform. Today there's nothing that supports it. The CommandBar does not have the classic left-to-right stacking of elements. So I guess at least you should provide a kind of ToolBarOverflowPanel where developers could put buttons, ComboBoxes and other controls inside and that creates automatically an overflow-menu with these controls.
